translation: Uttering the one-syllabled Om, the Brahman, and remembering Me, he who departs, leaving the body, attains the Supreme Goal.
commentary: 8.13 Om? It is thus? Onesyllabled onesyllabled? Brahma Brahman? expressing uttering? Maam Me? remembering remembering? who who? Goes departs? leaving leaving? Deham the body? He he? Yati attains? the supreme supreme? Gatim goal.Commentary Having controlled the thoughts the Yogi ascends by the Sushumna? the Nadi (subtle psychic nerve channel) which passes upwards from the heart. He fixes his whole Prana or lifreath in the crown of the head in the Brahmarandhra or the hole of Brahman. He utters the sacred monosyllable Om? meditates on Me and leaves the body.
